FuncDef:
The transmission-alarm holdup-timer command enables the filtering function for the delay clearance alarms, and set a filtering interval.
The undo transmission-alarm holdup-timer command recovers the preceding function.
By default, the preceding function is enabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the interval for filtering delay clearance alarms (If alarm clearance information is received within the holdup time, alarm information is filtered. Otherwise, the alarm is responded.).
The value is an integer ranging from 200 to 3600000 in milliseconds. The default value is 300 milliseconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The transmission-alarm holdup-timer command can be used to enable alarm clearance filtering and set a filtering interval.
Prerequisites
Transmission alarm customization has been enabled on an interface.
Precautions
For 10GE-WAN and WDM ports, if the up->down of a port exceeds two times within one minute, the default value of the port up suppression time is changed to 3s. If the interface is Up and is not Down within 5 minutes, the Up suppression time of the interface is restored to 300 ms.
